Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: State Senator; Former State Representative and Vice Chair of the Environment and Energy Committee; former Issaquah City Councilmember and Council President.
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Chief Data Officer at Crosswalk Labs, providing greenhouse emission inventories to local governments; Former Affiliate Faculty, UW Urban Design and Planning Department; Former Scientist at Breakthrough Energy modeling the clean energy transition and the electric grid.
Pamphlet_Education: PhD in Ecology, University of Illinois; BS in Biology, Cornell University.
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Community Emergency Response Team volunteer; volunteer in my children's school library and at Issaquah Food and Clothing Bank; served on regional boards addressing municipal issues and salmon conservation.
Pamphlet_Statement: As your State Senator, I will build upon my bipartisan work in the Legislature to promote housing affordability, a strong economy, transportation investments, and protection for our air, water, forests, and farmlands. As a public school mom, I'll continue fighting for K-12 education, affordable childcare, and the pathways to careers and college every young person deserves. In office, I've prioritized our community's needs, like Highway 18 safety improvements, police and public safety staffing, and behavioral health investments. I supported common-sense gun laws to safeguard kids and communities, and tough sentencing to protect victims of assault. With my background in clean energy and science, I have advanced policies that create jobs while meeting electricity needs in our growing communities and businesses. I will continue taking on local challenges – and federal threats to our rights and economy. I am a principled voice for data driven policies that support our families and small businesses, while standing up for reproductive rights, our schools and libraries, and action to address climate change.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: Former Issaquah School Board President elected to House of Representatives (2013-17); Served on Education (Ranking Member), Higher Education, Technology & Economic Development, Rules, and Appropriations committees; Appointed to five bipartisan school funding and quality task forces
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Computer science teacher (Bellevue SD); Software developer (Microsoft, Nike, Panasonic, etc.); U.S. Navy submarine officer
Pamphlet_Education: Master of Arts in Teaching from CWU; Bachelor of Science in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Cornell University
Pamphlet_Community_Service: PTA Outstanding Advocate; Microsoft TEALS volunteer; American Legion commander; AFS host; Eastside Education Network board; Tiger Mountain resident with wife (36 years) and two sons (graduated MIT and University of Utah)
Pamphlet_Statement: In a time of rising partisanship and growing disconnect in Olympia, voters in the 5th District have a chance to send a proven, independent leader back to the state legislature. As a former State Representative, I consistently put people ahead of politics. I built bipartisan coalitions to deliver real results for Washington families, including landmark progress on computer science education, public safety, emerging technologies, and leading negotiations to double state funding for schools while reducing property taxes in suburban districts. My background is unique. I served as a Navy submarine officer, developed software at Microsoft, and now teach computer science in the Bellevue School District. That experience has shaped my commitment to modernizing government, making it more efficient and open, and ensuring we're investing in the future, not wasting taxpayer dollars. Today, Olympia is more focused on partisan wins than everyday needs. Families are facing record new taxes, increased costs, and a government that feels increasingly out of touch. I'm running to restore balance, pursue practical solutions, and deliver tangible results for our state. I'm ready to serve again and work across the aisle to make Washington more balanced, affordable, and accountable. I would be honored to earn your vote.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: State Senator; Vice Chair of Health & Long-Term Care Committee; on Rules, Human Services, Housing and Joint Committee on Veterans' & Military Affairs. Former State Representative; Speaker Pro-Tempore; Co-Chair of the National Council of State Legislators Veterans & Military Affairs.
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: UW Affiliate Faculty with twenty years' experience in behavioral health, consulting, and grant writing, working with government and foundations to better serve our community.
Pamphlet_Education: Master's in Social Work & B.S. in Psychology from UW
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Kent Chamber of Commerce, Judson Park Retirement Community Board, United Way Impact Council, Veteran Suicide Prevention Task Force, Open Doors for Multicultural Families Housing Team.
Pamphlet_Statement: I am honored to serve you in the State Senate, where I've built on my record of legislative leadership-advancing legislation to address housing and behavioral health needs while investing in public safety, transportation and special education. I advocate for veterans and military families and have worked this year to shield communities from the harms of unregulated AI use. I'm proud of this year's bills that protect seniors in memory care, students on school campuses, and homeowners struggling to keep their homes. As a career social worker, protecting vulnerable Washingtonians has always been my focus, including survivors of sexual assault, gun violence, and suicide. With federal cuts threatening programs for struggling families, I've responded with legislation that invests in 988, provides new hearing aid coverage, increases community safety and maintains Board-Certified teacher incentives, among many others. With your vote, I'll continue working on affordable housing, comprehensive healthcare, airport pollution mitigation, language access in schools, childcare access for working families and finding climate solutions.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: State Representative, District 33 Position 1, Appointed in 2024
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: 25+ years in human services; Deputy Division Director, Seattle Human Services Department; Board President, Filipino Community of Seattle.
Pamphlet_Education: M.P.A., Northeastern University; B.A., University of Washington.
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Former Chair, SeaTac Human Services Advisory Committee; advocate for affordable housing, workers' rights, and public safety.
Pamphlet_Statement: Too many traditional politicians have become too comfortable with the status quo. Our region has become unaffordable, homelessness has dramatically increased and the Trump administration is only making things worse. In my first session, I fought to lift wages and improve working conditions. I limited rent increases. I've led and built affordable housing. I'll build on this record: K-12 education funding, transportation and transit investments, affordable childcare, rapidly build housing, and support our small businesses.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: Mayor of Burien 2024 - Present; Burien City Council 2019 - Present
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Government Affairs Director at Washington State Dental Association, Political Director for Congressman Derek Kilmer, Youth and Young Adult Minister at St. Francis of Assisi Parish and School, UFCW Grocery Clerk, and Restaurant Worker
Pamphlet_Education: St. Francis of Assisi School, Raisbeck Aviation High School, Washington State University, London School of Economics, Harvard Kennedy School for Senior Executives in State and Local Government
Pamphlet_Community_Service: AmeriCorps COVID-19 Emergency Response, Greater Seattle Business Association Policy Board, South Sound Chamber of Commerce Coalition Legislative Affairs Board, Seattle Opera BRAVO Council, Sons of the American Revolution
Pamphlet_Statement: I'm running to fix what's broken in Washington—corporate monopolies and out-of-touch politicians blocking common-sense solutions to safety, homelessness, and affordability. I'm the only candidate with a proven record of successfully tackling your priorities. As Mayor of Burien, I led with action: helping people off the streets and into housing, expanding treatment services, strengthening public safety, and balancing the budget while growing the economy. I'll work to make Washington more affordable and create opportunity. It's time we put Washingtonians first and make government actually work for you.

Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Non-profit leader building quality affordable housing and childcare; former Seattle Office of Housing Director investing $290 million to prevent displacement, support climate resilience, build supportive housing for homeless neighbors, protect renters, and expand homeownership; award-winning Planned Parenthood organizer; Attorney
Pamphlet_Education: BA, Scripps College (summa cum laude); JD, University of Washington School of Law (Gates Public Service Law Scholar)
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Former Board Member, Washington Low Income Housing Alliance; former member, Seattle Women's Commission; Volunteer Attorney, Latino Bar Association of Washington Community Legal Clinic; PTA parent of two Seattle Public School students
Pamphlet_Statement: It's a privilege to represent you in the State Senate. As a lifelong advocate for affordable housing and economic opportunity, I bring deep experience and a proven track record of delivering results. As your Senator, I've moved us forward on what matters: high-quality public schools, affordable housing, and access to childcare and healthcare. I'm proud to have championed policies that address the high cost of living by expanding protections for renters, workers, and consumers. I will continue to push for reforms to make homeownership more affordable, improve educational outcomes for kids, and strengthen the social safety net for youth and seniors. We all deserve reliable public services, and I'll keep advocating for the revenue and investments needed to make our communities healthy and safe. You can count on me to stand up for our democracy and civil rights, for reproductive freedom, common sense gun reform, and climate action. I'm committed to making government work for people—not special interests. I will always fight for a future where everyone has the opportunity to thrive. I'd be honored to earn your continued support.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: Appointed to the Legislature in January 2025. Candidate for Seattle City Council 2015, 2021
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: 15+ years of public service including, but not limited to: Mayor's Office Sr. Labor Advisor, Chief of Staff to Seattle City Council President, Chief of Staff to the Office of the Inspector General, Campaign Director Yes! for Seatac.
Pamphlet_Education: University of Washington, BA in Political Science 2010
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Served on the boards of Working Washington, Seattle City Club, The Church Council of Greater Seattle, the Washington Bus, Fuse Washington, NW Women's Political Caucus, Institute for a Democratic Future, the 34th Legislative District and the Downtown Emergency Service Center.
Pamphlet_Statement: I believe in fighting for working people, affordable housing, community safety, and shared prosperity. Here in the 34th LD, we are fortunate to have neighbors that still look out for each other and pitch in to improve our community. From Vashon to Delridge, White Center to Pioneer Square the people of this community care. I am asking for your support because I know how important it is to bring authenticity and tenacity to ensuring that each person of the 34th has a voice in Olympia, no matter their language or neighborhood.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: State Representative, Committees: Local Government, Housing, Capital Budget and Transportation; Bellevue Councilmember (2017-2025)
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Chief Engineer and Public Works Construction Manager, Port of Seattle; Structural Engineer, Berger/ABAM Engineers
Pamphlet_Education: B.S. and M.S. Civil Engineering and Executive Master of Public Administration, University of Washington; Leadership Eastside; Leadership Tomorrow
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Bellevue Schools Foundation, Trustee; The Sophia Way, Boardmember; Nourishing Networks, Boardmember; National League of Cities, Board of Directors; Chinese Institute of Engineers, Advisory Boardmember; International School PTA; Puesta del Sol Elementary PTA; Girl Scout leader; PEPS leader; Bellevue Transportation Commission, Chair; Port of Seattle Community Giving Campaign, Chair; Transportation Research Board, Committee member; and more.
Pamphlet_Statement: I'm honored to serve as your Representative, bringing local government and transportation experience to Olympia. As a first-generation immigrant, engineer, and longtime public servant, I've delivered tangible results with bills on healthcare, homelessness, and infrastructure. My fiscally-responsible, people-first solutions uplift every community. Together, we will build a Washington where everyone can thrive.

Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: I've enjoyed a 35 year career working on management teams for various builders and real estate companies.
Pamphlet_Education: Bachelor of Science Business Administration, University of Denver.
Pamphlet_Community_Service: For 30 years, I've been dedicated to shaping lives—mentoring kids, young couples, and adults through Bible studies and church outreach. I've traveled on mission trips to various third world countries where hope is desperately needed. I've worked to serve the homeless and struggling families—opening our own home and supporting our church's food bank. These efforts are part of a lifelong calling to help others.
Pamphlet_Statement: I've raised my family in Bellevue. I've spent my life serving our community through faith, not politics. But I'm tired of watching Olympia ignore our values -- and now I'm stepping up to fight for us. I'll cut taxes, prioritize public safety by reducing crime, and demand we get back to the basics in education. I bring real-life experience, not empty promises. Olympia needs to stop wasting our tax dollars and then raise them to cover their pet projects. I'm ready to stand up and get results, for you – the people, not just for the party line.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: Senator, 48th LD; Vice Chair-Environment, Energy, Technology Committee; Member- Health/Long-Term Care, Higher Education/Workforce Development Committees; Co-Chair- Science, Innovation, Technology Caucus; 2021-24 WA Student Association Legislator of the Year; former 48th LD State Representative, Bellevue Councilmember.
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: 20+ year medical scientist in leading biotechnology companies including Amgen and Genentech; licensed clinical pharmacist.
Pamphlet_Education: Doctor of Pharmacy, UW; Master of Public Administration, UW; Bachelor of Science (Pharmacy), UBC.
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Hopelink Board; UW Evans School Dean's Council; Ruckelshaus Center Advisory Board; Environmental Services Commission; Youth Link Board; Overlake Hospital Foundation Board; State Board of Pharmacy; NARAL ProChoice Foundation Board; Lake Hills Urban Farm.
Pamphlet_Statement: As your State Senator, I bring experience as a scientist, healthcare professional, mom and proud military parent to address local priorities amid federal uncertainty. I've delivered funding for affordable housing, I-405, transit, and local schools–while rejecting new taxes on small businesses and healthcare. I'm the only candidate in this race with a record of fighting for our shared values: protecting reproductive rights, rent stability for families, support for immigrants and workers. I sponsored legislation providing tools for public safety and behavioral health investments. I voted to expand career training, strengthen gun laws, address climate change, reduce medical debt, and ensure hospitals remain open. As lead sponsor of 'My Health My Data'--one of the nation's strongest medical privacy laws, and a constitutional amendment protecting abortion rights, I'm a proven advocate for personal freedoms. I'm a data-driven problem-solver representing our community's diversity and innovative spirit. Everyone deserves a chance to thrive-I'll keep fighting to make that possible.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: Current State Representative; Kirkland Mayor 2014-2018; Kirkland City Councilmember 2009-2019
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Over 20 years experience as an owner and executive in our family businesses
Pamphlet_Education: Bachelor of Laws, University of Queensland Law School; Bachelor of Arts, Political Science, University of Queensland
Pamphlet_Community_Service: I have always worked to make life better for people in my community, serving in volunteer and civic roles with organizations like Food Lifeline, Youth Eastside Services, PorchLight and Studio East, and securing scholarships for students to attend Lake Washington Institute of Technology. As a cancer survivor, I also make it a priority to support services for families impacted by cancer.
Pamphlet_Statement: I've spent the past 15 years earning the trust of 48th District voters—first as a Kirkland City Councilmember and Mayor, and now as your State Representative. I'm running for State Senate because this district deserves proven, accessible leadership—someone who listens, shows up, and delivers real results. In Olympia, I've worked to make life more affordable and secure for Eastside families. I passed legislation to remove medical debt from credit reports, expand access to affordable housing, support behavioral health and public safety, and defend reproductive freedom. I don't just sponsor bills—I work to get them across the finish line. I'm also a small business owner, Mom, and cancer survivor. I've navigated broken systems myself, and I bring empathy, fiscal responsibility, and practicality to every policy conversation. I know what our communities are facing—because I've lived it and led through it. This is a moment that demands urgency, accountability, and experience. The people you trust trust me—Democrats, labor unions, and small business owners. They've seen the work I've done and know I'll keep showing up for this district. I'd be honored to continue serving you as your next State Senator.

Pamphlet_Elected_Experience: State Representative, 48th LD; Redmond City Councilmember
Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Previous experience includes Medical Device Consultant, Fred Hutchinson Cancer Researcher, King County Community Engagement Manager, and coffee shop owner
Pamphlet_Education: BS Neurobiology & English Minor, University of Washington (Student Body President); LWSD Graduate
Pamphlet_Community_Service: Board member for Transportation Choices Coalition, Asian Pacific Islander Americans for Civic Empowerment, OneRedmond Foundation, Health Careers Ecosystem, Lawyers Helping Hungry Children; Member of LWSD Career & Technical Education Committee, Eastside Fire & Rescue Fire Corps; former Redmond youth basketball coach
Pamphlet_Statement: As your State Representative, I am focused on delivering results – improving public safety, transportation, and environmental protections while fighting for workers and small businesses. As a Redmond Councilmember and lifelong Eastsider, I understand local priorities: affordable housing, strong schools, healthcare access, and protecting our freedoms. I'm running to continue serving our communities with integrity and a commitment to common-sense solutions.

Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: The Boeing Company: Senior Procurement Financial Analyst, Credit Analyst, Senior Financial Analyst, High Risk Portfolio Management, Financial Analyst. I have also gained considerable business experience in accounting, finance, management, construction, manufacturing, business development, and consulting during my 34 years in Redmond. These skills will prove beneficial as your representative. Finally, I am also a proud US Air Force veteran and swore an oath to support and defend the Constitution of the United States. I remain committed to my oath.
Pamphlet_Education: Gonzaga University, Bachelor of Business Administration; Seattle University, Master of Science in Finance
Pamphlet_Statement: The current legislators propose the same failed policies: ever-increasing taxes, larger government, and excessive control. We need a fresh, conservative perspective on the issues driving up the cost of living and deteriorating the quality of life in our communities. I will provide that. Overburdensome taxes raise the cost of food, gas, housing, and business operations, provide little benefit to the public, and drive industry out of the area. When elected, I will commit my time to reducing taxes and fees, eliminating costly programs, and returning control to the people of Washington.

With a proven record as an independent, progressive policymaker, Rod has never missed a vote. He was named the Municipal League’s Elected Offi cial of the Year. Pamphlet_Education: University of Washington
Pamphlet_Statement: Black Diamond is a community shaped by change—whether it’s the closing of a coal mine, the opening of new businesses, or a new housing development—our town has never stood still, that’s why we’ve never faded like some others have. I’m running for mayor because I believe in building on this legacy of resilience and growth. As our town continues to evolve, we need leadership that supports thoughtful development—growth that benefi ts both longtime residents and new families. With the right planning, we can expand our infrastructure and services to meet future needs while preserving the small-town spirit that makes Black Diamond special. Change, when managed responsibly, brings opportunity. It energizes our community, supports local businesses, and strengthens our tax base. Elect me as your mayor, and together we’ll grow smart, protect what makes our town unique, and build a future we’re all proud of.

Pamphlet_Statement: I’m running for Duvall City Council to champion thoughtful growth that refl ects our shared values—preserving the small-town charm we love while planning smartly for our future. As Chair of the Duvall Planning Commission, I’ve worked with residents and local leaders to shape policy on housing, zoning, and sustainable development. With a strong foundation in infrastructure strategy, fi scal responsibility, and economic development, I bring a practical, solutions-driven approach. From managing half a billion dollar budgets to implementing mobility and transportation initiatives worldwide, I know how to deliver results that make communities stronger and more connected. If elected, I’ll focus on responsible housing, safer and more accessible pathways, and continued support for local businesses. Duvall deserves forward-thinking leadership rooted in respect for its history and hope for its future. Learn more about where I stand and how we can move Duvall forward—together—at www.Kosloske4Duvall.com.

Pamphlet_Education: MA, Gonzaga University. BA, Seattle Pacifi c University.
Pamphlet_Statement: Thank you for trusting me as your councilmember and mayor. I don’t have an opponent on the ballot, but you have my promise to ensure an uncontroversial and functioning government doing the everyday business of making our city a great place to live and visit. Much has changed in Washington since I fi rst joined government. I want you to feel okay believing that accountability is necessary when our laws are broken. For the things making our neighborhoods less safe, it’s okay to say, “This isn’t normal!”, and require that your government solve it. Our care for those who are hurting is only care when it helps, and our inclusion lacks meaning for those trapped outside society by government’s permission. Your ballot today is important. Many elected leaders statewide are partnering to solve our biggest problems, with compassion and accountability co-existing. I respectfully ask for your vote to help this grow. Let’s get social! Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Des Moines Deputy Mayor, City Council Member. Attorney. Former Judge.
Pamphlet_Education: J.D. from Santa Clara University School of Law; B.A. from San Diego State University
Pamphlet_Statement: Des Moines has faced challenges since 2022: leadership changes, budget shortfalls, and impacts from the pandemic. As your Deputy Mayor and city council member, I’ve worked to protect essential services like policing, while balancing the budget responsibly. I’ve focused on transparency, accountability, and results for our community. We’re investing in building a stronger future: revitalizing downtown, improving the permit process, and updating projects like Marina Steps and the Redondo Pier to be both community-focused and cost-eff ective. I’m proud to be endorsed by the 33rd LD Democrats, Senator Karen Keiser, Representative Tina Orwall, Lands Commissioner Dave Upthegrove, LiUNA 242, and many local leaders. All of whom believe in my commitment to community, public safety, and responsible leadership. I’d be honored to continue serving you and working to make our city safer, more connected, and more responsive to the people who call it home. I respectfully ask for your vote.

Pamphlet_Professional_Experience: Executive Director, SeaTac Senior Support Systems
Pamphlet_Education: University of Washington, Bachelor’s in Communication and Political Science
Pamphlet_Statement: I’m running for city council because our city needs to be thoughtful, inclusive, and rooted in the needs of every community that calls SeaTac home. We have made meaningful strides in pursuit of our shared goals; almost doubling our capacity for childcare, launching important economic development programs, building housing of all kinds, signaling our strong intent to protect North SeaTac Park from port development, and so much more. I’ll champion pragmatic policies that deliver tangible results for all our residents: increasing our stock of aff ordable and middle housing, creating safety in our neighborhoods, refusing to allow our residents to shoulder additional tax burdens, and protecting our natural amenities and parks. I’m proud to be endorsed by: The 33rd Legislative District Democrats, Mayor Mohamed Egal, Councilmember Jake Simpson, Councilmember James Lovell, and dozens of parents, workers, community leaders, and more. I’d love to earn your support. Michael Sanford (206) 290-5765 Mwsanford@live.com

Pamphlet_Education: Highline CC--Honor Society, Military specialized training--19D, 11H, 11M BFV, 96R Ground Surveillance Radar
Pamphlet_Statement: My life has been defi ned by service—to my country, my community, and my neighbors. I’m running for SeaTac Council to continue that commitment. A proud King County resident since 1961, I’ve lived in SeaTac for over a decade and served in leadership roles throughout my life, from Sergeant First Class in the Washington Army National Guard to President of the Bow Lake Homeowners Association. As a small business owner and security advisor, I understand the importance of safety, economic growth, and local empowerment. During the pandemic, I led a homeless engagement assessment project to connect vulnerable individuals with vital services. I’ve also led eff orts to help businesses reduce losses and increase profi tability through innovative security solutions, including drone technology. I’ll use my professional and life experiences to make SeaTac even better than it is today. Please help me to achieve this goal. Vote Michael Sanford for SeaTac Council.

Pamphlet_Education: Business Administration; University of Nevada-Las Vegas
Pamphlet_Statement: I’m running for Park Commissioner because parks are the heart of our community. They bring us together, promote wellness, and preserve the natural beauty we all cherish. As a long-time resident, I’ve created lasting memories in our local parks with my family, grandchildren, and even our dog! I care deeply about maintaining and improving our parks, trails, and recreational spaces for all ages. With a background in community service and leadership as a Team Lead/Supervisor, I understand the importance of listening, thoughtful planning, and using public funds wisely. I will prioritize accessibility, safety, green space preservation, and long- term sustainability—ensuring our parks remain vibrant and welcoming for generations to come. I’m not a politician—I’m your neighbor. And I’d be honored to serve as your Park Commissioner with integrity, energy, and a commitment to open communication. Streets must be safe for cyclists and pedestrians, especially near mass transit and areas like North City, Shoreline Place, parks, and teen and senior centers. I’m ready to be an eff ective council member and to serve all the people of Shoreline. I ask for your vote.

Pamphlet_Statement: My name is Kristi Krumperman, and I am a dedicated educator and manager of a small business specializing in early childhood education. Nearly a decade ago, my family chose Maple Valley for its exceptional schools. Today, two of my three children attend schools in our district, deepening my commitment to this community. With experience in both the classroom and business management, I bring a well-rounded perspective on the challenges and opportunities facing our schools. I am passionate about transparency in decision- making, student safety, progressive education, and strong school- community partnerships. Every child deserves a safe, supportive, and future-focused learning environment. As a school board member, I will advocate for thoughtful policies and work collaboratively with parents, educators, and the community to promote continued excellence in our schools.

Pamphlet_Statement: As Tukwila Pool’s current Commissioner, I am invested in the current state and future of our pool. I originally ran for the position because my son loved swimming and I wanted to be part of something that he loved. Now that I have been in offi ce and involved with the pool community for the past 6 years, I have found that it is a community that I would love to stay part of and keep serving. I appreciate the opportunities that were open to me, including being part of the pool’s various committees and public events, and have developed a passion for water safety and public health. The Tukwila Pool provides a safe and fun space for adults to exercise and for kids to spend their summers, and I enjoy being part of such a valuable resource that brings our community together.

Pamphlet_Statement: Woodinville is my hometown. I grew up here, and now I’m raising my own family in the same community I love. I am running for the Fire & Rescue Commissioner board to ensure our district remains well-prepared, well-staff ed, and responsive to the growing needs of our neighborhoods. I advocate for and support our aging population and those with intellectual, developmental, and physical challenges. I also work with our valley youth, creating and delivering programs focused on deadly substances like fentanyl. Professionally, I’ve worked for over 30 years in business executive roles and served 17 years as a Fire Commissioner. My medical, business, and public leadership, give me a unique and balanced perspective.

Pamphlet_Statement: Over 45 years working in our community with some of its healthcare needs, I have not yet seen a time when local social and health resources have been as robust as many Islanders would desire. This is still true today. The Vashon Health Care District was created about 6 years ago to address the approaching loss of our primary care clinic and to consider which additional unmet healthcare needs that our neighbors most prioritize. I am pleased that the District hasn’t raised the original levy amount at any time over those 6 years in spite of launching additional programs including 365-day Urgent Care, enhanced Behavioral Health for Island youth, a voucher program to assist low-income residents with health care access, and collaboration with VIFR to enhance in-home health services for our vulnerable adults. I wish to continue my work as a VHCD Commissioner and I ask for your vote.

I’ve been an avid pilot and advocate for aviation since that time accumulating nearly twenty-thousand hours of fl ight time in a variety of aircraft. This time includes more than twenty-three years with Alaska Air Group, the last twelve years as a B737 Captain for Alaska Airlines. My public service experience on Vashon Island, includes eight years as a Park Commissioner for Vashon Park District, six years on the Board of Directors (fi ve as President) of Vashon Community Care, Founder of Vashon Community Care Foundation, and I served on the boards of Vashon Forest Stewards and Voice of Vashon. The Vashon Municipal Airport is a valuable community asset which will play a pivotal role in the event of a major disaster here on Vashon Island. It is my desire to see that this asset is maintained in the safest fashion possible.

Pamphlet_Statement: As Tukwila Pool’s current Commissioner, I am invested in the current state and future of our pool. I originally ran for the position because my son loved swimming and I wanted to be part of something that he loved. Now that I have been in offi ce and involved with the pool community for the past 6 years, I have found that it is a community that I would love to stay part of and keep serving. I appreciate the opportunities that were open to me, including being part of the pool’s various committees and public events, and have developed a passion for water safety and public health. The Tukwila Pool provides a safe and fun space for adults to exercise and for kids to spend their summers, and I enjoy being part of such a valuable resource that brings our community together.

Pamphlet_Statement: Rod Dembowski is a community-focused, results-driven Councilmember, rooted in service and committed to improving the lives of King County residents. With a proven record as an independent, progressive policymaker, Rod has never missed a vote. He was named the Municipal League’s Elected Offi cial of the Year. Rod is dedicated to eff ectively addressing the region’s most pressing issues: health and safety, aff ordability, conservation, and poverty. Health & Safety. Rod championed the Behavioral Health Institute at Harborview, kept public health clinics open, and is standing up crisis King County care centers and mobile response teams, countywide. Rod increased Metro Transit security, created King County’s gun buyback program, and implemented eff ective law enforcement oversight systems. Elections does Aff ordability. As Chair of the Budget Committee, Rod has worked to manage the cost of King County programs, ensuring their eff ectiveness and advancing reforms. He wrote legislation to decarbonize Metro Transit, and passed our climate action plan. grammar, or Supporting Those In Need.
